full_text:
"As the crow flies" or "in a beeline" is an idiom for the shortest distance between two points ; the geodesic distance.
An example is the great-circle distance between the cities of Key West and Pensacola, at either end of the U.S. state of Florida, where the direct point-to-point aerial transit path  is 524 mi  the shortest route by road is about 792 mi .
The phrases are attested in print as early as 1758.
title: As the Crow Flies
